item.title: Articles
item.description: .card_wrapper { box-shadow: 5px 5px 3px grey; border-width: 1px; border-color: grey; border-style: solid; margin-bottom: 30px; padding: 2%; } .publisher_title { color: #464646; letter-spacing: .2px; font-family: Oxygen,Arial,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-weight: 700; margin: -1% 0% 1% 0%; } .article_title { margin: 1% 0% 0% 0%; } .article_image { width:80%; height: 370px; display: block; margin: auto; object-fit: cover; } .article_desc { margin: 1% 0% 0% 0%; } Medium - Towards Data Science, Joseph Early Reproducible Data Science using Kaggle and GitHub Actions (26 Dec 2019) With the emerging reproducibility crisis in data science, it is becoming more important for data science researchers to provide open access to their code.

item.title: About
item.description: Joseph is a doctoral student with the University of Southampton and the Alan Turing Institute. He completed an undergraduate degree in computer science at the University of Southampton, and then specialised with a master’s degree focused on machine learning (also at the University of Southampton). Joseph pursed his interest in machine learning and is now researching explainable artificial intelligence – the process of unpacking the “black box” of machine learning and understanding why models exhibit certain behaviours.
